alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 10:18AM CST until February 11 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Washington, Clarke and Choctaw Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...Until late Friday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 33.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Tuesday was 33.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday evening and continue falling to 26.1 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
